results.title: Swords and ploughshares
results.creator_credit: Robert Raymond, Christopher McCullough and Opus Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Out of the fiery furnace”.
EPISODE 2 OF OUT OF THE FIERY FURNACE - Iron became a universal replacement for bronce; techniques evolved to “steel”, quench and temper it. The Bronze Age collapsed when a new metal “iron” emerged. The Chinese who were the first to cast it, developed huge blast furnaces. The Hittites, of Turkey, were the first to make iron of good quality, and the iron age spread from Damascus throughout Europe. Shows the importance of mining to the ancient civilizations of Grece and Rome. Presented by Michael Charlton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Raymond, Christopher McCullough and Opus Films

results.title: Switzerland/Texas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Filmstruck Series”.
Filming in Australia has been described as “Switzerland wanting to go to Texas”. In this program, John Baxter, well-known Australian film historian and cinema critic, looks at the state of the Australian film industry. This is part five of a ten part documentary “Filmstruck” which considers the impact of cinema on the social and personal life of the viewing audience.

results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS

results.title: Swiss ski symphony = Schweizer ski-symphonie
results.brief_description: Scenes of skiing of all kinds are carefully edited to synchronise with a symphonic piece played by a full orchestra. Photography by Josef Dahinden and music by Jean Daetwyler. No commentary.

results.title: Swiss on white: winter sports at St. Moritz
results.creator_credit: Phillip M. Brown and Central Films
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine style documentary on winter sports at St Moritz, Switzerland. Items include ice skating, ice hockey, horse racing on ice, trick skating, toboganning, skiing, snow marathon and ski jumping.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson [Extracts]
results.brief_description:
While travelling aboard a 19th Century sailing vessel, the sophisticated Robinson family survive a devastating shipwreck and are forced to carve out a daring, primitive new life for themselves on a dangerous, deserted tropical island. Cast includes Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur.
Extracts taken from the Walt Disney 1960 feature film production.

results.title: Swinging the broom
results.creator_credit: Andrew Wiseman, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Geoffrey Hall
results.brief_description: An elderly street sweeper, who has grown tired of his supposedly nagging wife, seeks relief from her by meeting the young woman he sees on his cleaning round. Ending up badly beaten, after his intentions have been misunderstood by one of the women, he arrives home to discover a caring wife. They make up and his misguided ways appear over. But are they?

results.title: Swing Fitness for Older Adults
results.brief_description: This gentle, all new, swing movement video is designed specifically for the young at heart (30-80 years) who wish to keep supple, healthy and full of life with a minimum of effort and a maximum amount of enjoyment. If you are ready to begin exercising in the safest way possible, you are ready for this remarkable program.

results.title: Swing away
results.creator_credit: Castle Films, United World Films and Max Glandbard
results.brief_description: Golfer Tommy Armour demonstrates the importance of coordinated balance, rhythm, and timing in the backswing and the downswing. Shows the advantage of the closed stance for the drive and other long wood shots and of the square stance for long iron shots. Discusses the specific uses of various golf clubs. Includes demonstrations in slow motion photography.

results.title: Swing and sing
results.brief_description: A collection of big band jazz music with classic songs “The Boogie Woogieman”, “Dancing on air” and “Fantasia” which eventually set the popular tunes and rhythms in 1950s United States. Featuring Will Osborne and his Orchestra, Martha Tilton - Brian Sisters and the Aida Broadbent Dancers.
